problem:
There is a complex number $z$ with imaginary part $164$ and a positive integer $n$ such that
$$\frac {z}{z + n} = 4i.$$Find $n$.
solution: Multiplying by $z+n$, we have $z = 4i(z+n)$, or $z(1-4i) = 4ni$. Thus \[z = \frac{4ni}{1-4i} = \frac{4ni(1+4i)}{17} = \frac{4ni - 16n}{17}.\]Since $z$ has imaginary part $164$, we have $4n/17 = 164$, so $n = 17/4 \cdot 164 = \boxed{697}$.
